Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;5.02. Departure of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers. Amended and Restated Alphabet Inc. 2021 Stock Plan At the Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Alphabet Inc. (&#8220; Alphabet &#8221;) held on June&#160;1, 2022 (the &#8220; 2022 Annual Meeting &#8221;), Alphabet&#8217;s stockholders approved an amendment to Alphabet Inc. 2021 Stock Plan (the &#8220; 2021 Stock Plan &#8221;) to increase the share reserve by 4,000,000 shares of Class&#160;C capital stock. A description of the 2021 Stock Plan and related matters was set forth in Alphabet&#8217;s definitive proxy statement on Form 14A filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on April&#160;22, 2022 (the &#8220; 2022 Proxy Statement &#8221;) and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of the 2021 Stock Plan, a copy of which is being filed as Exhibit 10.01 to this Form 8-K. &#160; Item&#160;5.03. Amendments to Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws; Change in Fiscal Year. At the 2022 Annual Meeting, Alphabet&#8217;s stockholders approved an amendment to the Alphabet&#8217;s Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation (the &#8220; Charter &#8221;) to increase the number of authorized shares in connection with a 20-for-one stock split of Alphabet&#8217;s Class&#160;A common stock, Class&#160;B common stock, and Class&#160;C capital stock (the &#8220; Charter Amendment &#8221;). The Charter Amendment became effective upon its filing with the Secretary of State of the State of Delaware on June&#160;3, 2022. As previously announced, each Alphabet stockholder of record at the close of business on July&#160;1, 2022 (the &#8220; Stock Split Record Date &#8221;) will receive, after the close of business on July&#160;15, 2022, 19 additional shares for every one share held as of the Stock Split Record Date. Trading is expected to begin on a split-adjusted basis on July&#160;18, 2022. This description of the Charter Amendment is not complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the text of the Charter, as amended and restated, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit 3.01 to this Form 8-K. &#160; Item&#160;5.07. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. At the 2022 Annual Meeting, Alphabet&#8217;s stockholders voted on twenty-one proposals as set forth below, all of which are described in detail in the 2022 Proxy Statement. Holders of the shares of Class&#160;A common stock were entitled to one vote per share held as of the close of business on April&#160;5, 2022 (the &#8220; Record Date &#8221;) and holders of the shares of Class&#160;B common stock were entitled to ten votes per share held as of the Record Date. Holders of the shares of Class&#160;A common stock and holders of the shares of Class&#160;B common stock voted together as a single class on all matters (including the election of directors) submitted to a vote of stockholders at the 2022 Annual Meeting. The number of votes cast for and against and the number of abstentions and broker non-votes with respect to each matter voted upon are set forth below. 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the 2022 Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Alphabet until the next annual meeting of stockholders or until their respective successors have been duly elected and qualified: &#160; Director Nominee &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes Larry Page &#160; 592,852,727 &#160; 10,483,152 &#160; 444,070 &#160; 30,350,444 Sergey Brin &#160; 592,848,088 &#160; 10,485,256 &#160; 446,605 &#160; 30,350,444 Sundar Pichai &#160; 595,666,963 &#160; 7,658,201 &#160; 454,785 &#160; 30,350,444 John L. Hennessy &#160; 553,426,687 &#160; 49,316,543 &#160; 1,036,719 &#160; 30,350,444 &#160; 2 Frances H. Arnold &#160; 589,868,660 &#160; 12,865,280 &#160; 1,046,009 &#160; 30,350,444 L. John Doerr &#160; 570,481,269 &#160; 32,801,993 &#160; 496,687 &#160; 30,350,444 Roger W. Ferguson, Jr. &#160; 598,326,295 &#160; 4,942,318 &#160; 511,336 &#160; 30,350,444 Ann Mather &#160; 537,742,671 &#160; 65,444,274 &#160; 593,004 &#160; 30,350,444 K. Ram Shriram &#160; 583,326,313 &#160; 19,954,131 &#160; 499,505 &#160; 30,350,444 Robin L. Washington &#160; 590,506,893 &#160; 12,772,617 &#160; 500,439 &#160; 30,350,444 2. The ratification of the appointment of Ernst&#160;&amp; Young LLP as Alphabet&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December&#160;31, 2022. There were no broker non-votes on this matter. This proposal was approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions 617,716,269 &#160; 15,840,842 &#160; 573,282 3. The approval of an amendment to the 2021 Stock Plan to increase the share reserve by 4,000,000 shares of Class&#160;C capital stock. This proposal was approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 506,345,892 &#160; 96,866,593 &#160; 567,464 &#160; 30,350,444 4. The approval of an amendment to Alphabet&#8217;s Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation to increase the number of authorized shares. There were no broker non-votes on this matter. This proposal was approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions 609,336,661 &#160; 24,202,969 &#160; 590,763 5. A stockholder proposal regarding a lobbying report. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 114,337,748 &#160; 488,159,890 &#160; 1,282,311 &#160; 30,350,444 6. A stockholder proposal regarding a climate lobbying report. A stockholder proposal regarding a racial equity audit. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 134,699,006 &#160; 466,991,436 &#160; 2,089,507 &#160; 30,350,444 10. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on concealment clauses. This is proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 72,130,367 &#160; 528,736,242 &#160; 2,913,340 &#160; 30,350,444 11. A stockholder proposal regarding equal shareholder voting. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on government takedown requests. A stockholder proposal regarding a human rights assessment of data center siting. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 102,603,593 &#160; 498,995,355 &#160; 2,181,001 &#160; 30,350,444 14. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on data collection, privacy, and security. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 73,742,058 &#160; 528,275,894 &#160; 1,761,997 &#160; 30,350,444 15. A stockholder proposal regarding misinformation and disinformation. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 138,860,290 &#160; 462,429,154 &#160; 2,490,505 &#160; 30,350,444 17. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on external costs of disinformation. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 21,171,063 &#160; 578,562,198 &#160; 4,046,688 &#160; 30,350,444 18. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on board diversity. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 31,672,686 &#160; 569,647,268 &#160; 2,459,995 &#160; 30,350,444 &#160; 5 19. A stockholder proposal regarding the establishment of an environmental sustainability board committee. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 28,643,318 &#160; 572,059,570 &#160; 3,077,061 &#160; 30,350,444 20. A stockholder proposal regarding a policy on non-management employee representative director. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 15,377,634 &#160; 587,364,843 &#160; 1,037,472 &#160; 30,350,444 21. A stockholder proposal regarding a report on policies regarding military and militarized policing agencies. This proposal was not approved as set forth below: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstentions &#160; Broker Non-Votes 55,301,799 &#160; 544,653,039 &#160; 3,825,111 &#160; 30,350,444 &#160; Item&#160;8.01. Other Events. Effective as of June&#160;1, 2022, Robin L. Washington will serve as a member of the Audit and Compliance Committee of the Board of Directors of Alphabet (the &#8220; Board &#8221;). Ms.&#160;Washington will continue to serve as chair of the Leadership Development, Inclusion and Compensation Committee of the Board. &#160; Item&#160;9.01. Financial Statements and Exhibits.
